name: ultimate mittens
sizes_available: kid (adult small, adult medium, adult large, adult x-large)
notes:
materials
- 1 (2, 2, 2, 2) skein(s) of purl soho’s [nigh aran][1], 100% cashmere. each skein of this worsted/aran weight yarn is 100 yards/ 55 grams; approximately 80 (110, 130, 145, 165) total yards required. we used the colors pink pearl and yew green.
- a set of us 6 (4mm) [double pointed needles][2] or us 6, 32-inch circular needles for magic loop
- [stitch markers][3], including one unique
- scrap yarn

note: if you prefer hand warmers to mittens, the pattern includes instructions for them, too. the hand warmer version requires 1 (1, 2, 2, 2) skein(s) or approximately 75 (100, 120, 135, 155) total yards.

gauge
18 stitches and 28 rounds = 4 inches in stockinette stitch

sizes
kid (adult small, adult medium, adult large, adult x-large)

- finished circumference at wrist: 5¼ (5¾, 6¼, 7, 7½) inches
- finished circumference at palm: 6¼ (7, 7½, 8, 8½) inches
- finished length from cuff to tip: 8½ (10, 10¾, 11½, 12¼) inches with rolled edge, instructions to modify

samples: the pink pearl mittens are the kid size and the yew green mittens are the adult medium size.

pattern based on the [essential mittens][4] designed by purl soho designer, [jake canton][5], and updated and written for nigh aran by purl soho designer, [gaby bush][6].


  [1]: https://www.purlsoho.com/nigh-aran.html
